title: How to Make Pumpkin Pie Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).
Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, sift the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Sift the flour, baking powder, and baking soda.

steps.headline: In a separate large bowl, cream the butter and sugar with an electric mixer, until the mixture is light and fluffy.
Crack in the egg and add the vanilla extract.
steps.description: Blend again on high speed for about a minute.

steps.headline: Slowly pour in the flour mixture.
steps.description: Blend on low speed slowly for about two minutes, until the dough forms and there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Using a mini ice cream scoop or tablespoon, drop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet.
steps.description: Leave a few inches of space between each cookie to avoid them from spreading onto each other.

steps.headline: Gently flatten the cookies using a rubber spatula.
Using a pizza cutter, cut each cookie into triangular pieces to resemble 'pie slices'.
Bake the cookies for about 8-10 minutes, until the edges are golden brown.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven and allow the cookies to cool for about 10 minutes.
Spread the orange frosting over all the cookies using a large butterknife.
Make the 'pie crust' on the cookies.
steps.description: Fill a frosting pipe with light brown frosting. Using a swirled piping tip, form the 'pie crust' near the top of each cookie.

steps.headline: Dollop the 'whipped cream' on top.
steps.description: Fill a frosting pipe with vanilla frosting. Squirt a small amount of vanilla frosting on each cookie to resemble 'whipped cream'.

steps.headline: Allow the frosting to harden for about 10-15 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine the egg, melted butter, and sugar with an electric mixer.
steps.description: Blend on medium speed for about a minute.

steps.headline: Pour in the pumpkin pie filling, molasses, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and allspice.
steps.description: Blend again on medium speed until well-combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Pour in the salt, baking powder, and flour. Use a rubber spatula to combine the dry ingredients together. Mix until well-combined and there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Using a mini ice cream scoop or tablespoon, drop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet.
steps.description: Leave a few inches of space between each cookie to avoid them from spreading onto each other.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies in the oven for about 10 minutes, until they are golden brown and have fully baked
Remove the baking sheet from the oven and allow the cookies to cool for about 10 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Pumpkin Pie Slice Shaped Cookies Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).  Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.  In a small bowl, sift the dry ingredients. Sift the flour, baking powder, and baking soda. In a separate large bowl, cream the butter and sugar with an electric mixer, until the mixture is light and fluffy.  Crack in the egg and add the vanilla extract. Blend again on high speed for about a minute. Slowly pour in the flour mixture. Blend on low speed slowly for about two minutes, until the dough forms and there are no more flour streaks. Using a mini ice cream scoop or tablespoon, drop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet. Leave a few inches of space between each cookie to avoid them from spreading onto each other. Gently flatten the cookies using a rubber spatula.  Using a pizza cutter, cut each cookie into triangular pieces to resemble 'pie slices'.  Bake the cookies for about 8-10 minutes, until the edges are golden brown.  Remove the baking sheet from the oven and allow the cookies to cool for about 10 minutes.  Spread the orange frosting over all the cookies using a large butterknife.  Make the 'pie crust' on the cookies. Fill a frosting pipe with light brown frosting. Using a swirled piping tip, form the 'pie crust' near the top of each cookie. Dollop the 'whipped cream' on top. Fill a frosting pipe with vanilla frosting. Squirt a small amount of vanilla frosting on each cookie to resemble 'whipped cream'. Allow the frosting to harden for about 10-15 minutes.  Serve. Place the cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy! Pumpkin Pie Flavored Cookies Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.  In a large bowl, combine the egg, melted butter, and sugar with an electric mixer. Blend on medium speed for about a minute. Pour in the pumpkin pie filling, molasses, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and allspice. Blend again on medium speed until well-combined. Fold in the dry ingredients. Pour in the salt, baking powder, and flour. Use a rubber spatula to combine the dry ingredients together. Mix until well-combined and there are no more flour streaks. Using a mini ice cream scoop or tablespoon, drop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet. Leave a few inches of space between each cookie to avoid them from spreading onto each other. Bake the cookies in the oven for about 10 minutes, until they are golden brown and have fully baked  Remove the baking sheet from the oven and allow the cookies to cool for about 10 minutes.  Serve. Place the cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy! Finished.
